1{-# LANGUAGE ViewPatterns #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
3{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
4
5-- | Gadgets with content calculation.
6
7module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Cox.Gadget
8  ( ropsCoxGadget,
9  
10    -- * const
11    consConst, relmapConst, relkitConst,
12
13    -- * number
14    consNumber, relmapNumber, relkitNumber,
15  
16    -- * rank
17    consRank,
18    relmapGapRank, relkitGapRank,
19    relmapDenseRank, relkitDenseRank,
20  
21    -- * repeat
22    consRepeat,
23  
24    -- * array
25    consArray, relmapArray, relkitArray,
26    -- * unarray
27    consUnarray, relmapUnarray, relkitUnarray,
28  ) where
29
30import Prelude hiding (getContents)
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.DataPlus           as K
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core               as C
33import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base           as Rop
34import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Cox.GeoDatumJp as Rop
35import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base.Message   as Msg
36
37
38-- | Implementation of relational operators.
39ropsCoxGadget :: (K.CContent c) => [C.Rop c]
40ropsCoxGadget = Rop.rops "cox-gadget"
41    [ consConst      K.& [ "const R"                       K.& "-lit" ]
42    , consGeoDatumJp K.& [ "geo-datum-jp E E E -to /N /N"  K.& "-n -x -y . -to" ]
43    , consGeoDegree  K.& [ "geo-degree /N /P /P /P"        K.& "-real -deg -min -sec" ]
44    , consInterp     K.& [ "interp E"                      K.& "-interp . -x?" ]
45    , consNumber     K.& [ "number /N -order /P ..."       K.& "-term . -order? -from?" ]
46    , consRank       K.& [ "rank /N -order /P ..."         K.& "-term . -order? -from? -dense?" ]
47    , consRepeat     K.& [ "repeat I R"                    K.& "-count -relmap/" ]
48    , consArray      K.& [ "array /P /P ... -to /N [E] ..."
49                           K.& "to : -term* . -to" ]
50    , consUnarray    K.& [ "unarray /N /N ... -from /P [E] ..."
51                           K.& "from : -term* . -from" ]
52    ]
53
54
55-- ----------------------  const
56
57-- | [const /E/]
58--     Output the constant relation E.
59--     Especially, @const {= [] =}@ is equivalent to @dee@,
60--     @const {= =}@ is equivalent to @dum@.
61--
62consConst :: (K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
63consConst med =
64    do lit <- Rop.getContent med "-lit"
65       case K.isRel lit of
66         True  -> Right $ relmapConst med $ K.gRel lit
67         False -> Msg.reqRel
68
69-- | Create @const@ relmap.
70relmapConst :: C.Intmed c -> K.Rel c -> C.Relmap c
71relmapConst med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitConst
72
73-- | Create @const@ relkit.
74relkitConst :: K.Rel c -> C.RelkitFlow c
75relkitConst _ Nothing = C.relkitUnfixed
76relkitConst r _ = Right $ C.relkitConstRel r
77
78
79-- ----------------------  geo-datum-jp
80
81--  geo-datum-jp /n /x /y -to /lat /long
82
83consGeoDatumJp :: (Ord c, K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
84consGeoDatumJp med =
85    do n  <- Rop.getCox med "-n"
86       x  <- Rop.getCox med "-x"
87       y  <- Rop.getCox med "-y"
88       (lat, long) <- Rop.getTerm2 med "-to"
89       let cops = C.globalCopset $ C.getGlobal med
90       Right $ relmapGeoDatumJp med (cops, (n,x,y), (lat,long))
91
92-- | Create @geo-datum-jp@ relmap.
93relmapGeoDatumJp :: (Ord c, K.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> (K.CopSet c, K.Cox3 c, K.TermName2) -> C.Relmap c
94relmapGeoDatumJp med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitGeoDatumJp
95
96-- | Create @geo-datum-jp@ relkit.
97relkitGeoDatumJp :: (Ord c, K.CContent c) => (K.CopSet c, K.Cox3 c, K.TermName2) -> C.RelkitFlow c
98relkitGeoDatumJp _ Nothing = C.relkitUnfixed
99relkitGeoDatumJp (cops, (coxn,coxx,coxy), (lat,long)) (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
100    he2       = K.headAppend [lat, long] he1
101    kit2      = C.relkitLineAb False he2 flow
102    pReal     = K.pDec . K.realDecimal 4
103
104    flow cs   = do cn    <- K.coxRunCox cops he1 cs coxn
105                   cx    <- K.coxRunCox cops he1 cs coxx
106                   cy    <- K.coxRunCox cops he1 cs coxy
107
108                   decn  <- K.getDec $ Right cn
109                   decx  <- K.getDec $ Right cx
110                   decy  <- K.getDec $ Right cy
111
112                   let n  = fromInteger $ K.decimalNum decn
113                       dx = K.decimalFractional decx :: Double
114                       dy = K.decimalFractional decy :: Double
115                       (dlat, dlong) = Rop.convDegree n (dx, dy)
116
117                   Right $ pReal dlat : pReal dlong : cs
118
119
120-- ----------------------  geo-degree
121
122--  geo-degree /deg-real /deg /min /sec
123
124consGeoDegree :: (Ord c, K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
125consGeoDegree med =
126    do real <- Rop.getTerm med "-real"
127       deg  <- Rop.getTerm med "-deg"
128       mnt  <- Rop.getTerm med "-min"
129       sec  <- Rop.getTerm med "-sec"
130       Right $ relmapGeoDegree med (real, deg, mnt, sec)
131
132-- | Create @geo-degree@ relmap.
133relmapGeoDegree :: (Ord c, K.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> K.TermName4 -> C.Relmap c
134relmapGeoDegree med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitGeoDegree
135
136-- | Create @geo-degree@ relkit.
137relkitGeoDegree :: (Ord c, K.CContent c) => K.TermName4 -> C.RelkitFlow c
138relkitGeoDegree _ Nothing = C.relkitUnfixed
139relkitGeoDegree (real, deg, mnt, sec) (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
140    he2       = K.headCons real he1
141    kit2      = C.relkitLineAb False he2 flow
142    pick      = K.pickDirect [deg, mnt, sec] he1
143    pReal     = K.pDec . K.realDecimal 4
144
145    flow cs   = do let [cdeg, cmnt, csec] = pick cs
146
147                   hdeg <- K.getDec $ Right cdeg
148                   hmnt <- K.getDec $ Right cmnt
149                   hsec <- K.getDec $ Right csec
150
151                   let ddeg = K.decimalFractional hdeg :: Double
152                       dmnt = K.decimalFractional hmnt :: Double
153                       dsec = K.decimalFractional hsec :: Double
154                       dmnt' = dmnt + dsec  / 60
155                       ddeg' = ddeg + dmnt' / 60
156
157                   Right $ pReal ddeg' : cs
158
159
160-- ----------------------  interp
161
162consInterp :: (K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
163consInterp med =
164    do skip <- Rop.getSwitch med "-x"
165       case skip of
166         True  -> Right $ Rop.relmapId med
167         False -> consInterp2 med
168
169consInterp2 :: (K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
170consInterp2 med =
171    do c <- Rop.getContent med "-interp"
172       case K.isInterp c of
173         True  -> Right $ relmapInterp med $ K.gInterp c
174         False -> Msg.reqInterp
175
176-- | Create @interp@ relmap.
177relmapInterp :: (K.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> K.Interp -> C.Relmap c
178relmapInterp med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitInterp
179
180-- | Create @interp@ relkit.
181relkitInterp :: (K.CContent c) => K.Interp -> C.RelkitFlow c
182relkitInterp _ Nothing = C.relkitUnfixed
183relkitInterp interp (Just he1)
184    | interpMatch interp he1 = Right $ C.relkitId (Just he1)
185    | otherwise              = Msg.unkTerm (K.interpTerms interp) he1
186
187interpMatch :: K.Interp -> K.Head -> Bool
188interpMatch interp he = ns1 == ns2 where
189    ns1 = K.sort $ K.interpTerms interp
190    ns2 = K.sort $ K.getTermNames he
191
192
193-- ----------------------  number
194
195-- | __number \/N -from I -order \/P ...__
196consNumber :: (Ord c, K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
197consNumber med =
198    do n    <- Rop.getTerm                med "-term"
199       ns   <- Rop.getOpt [] Rop.getTerms med "-order"
200       from <- Rop.getOpt 0  Rop.getInt   med "-from"
201       Right $ relmapNumber med (n, ns, fromInteger from)
202
203-- | Create @number@ relmap.
204relmapNumber :: (K.CDec c, Ord c) => C.Intmed c -> (K.TermName, [K.TermName], Int) -> C.Relmap c
205relmapNumber med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitNumber
206
207-- | Create @number@ relkit.
208relkitNumber :: (Ord c, K.CDec c) => (K.TermName, [K.TermName], Int) -> C.RelkitFlow c
209relkitNumber = relkitRanking K.sortByNameNumbering
210
211relkitRanking
212    :: (Ord c, K.CDec c)
213    => K.Ranking K.TermName c
214    -> (K.TermName, [K.TermName], Int) -> C.RelkitFlow c
215relkitRanking _ _ Nothing = C.relkitUnfixed
216relkitRanking ranking (n, ns, from) (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
217    he2   = K.headCons n he1
218    kit2  = C.relkitWhole False he2 flow
219    flow bo1  = let (rank, bo2) = ranking from ords (K.getTermNames he1) bo1
220                in zipWith (:) (map K.pInt rank) bo2
221    ords  = (K.orderingCap . K.orderingTermName) <$> ns
222
223
224-- ----------------------  rank
225
226-- | [rank \/N -from I -order \/P ...]
227--     Calculate standard competition ranking (like 1224).
228--
229--   [rank \/N -dense -from I -order \/P...]
230--     Calculate dense ranking (like 1223).
231--
232consRank :: (Ord c, K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
233consRank med =
234    do n     <- Rop.getTerm             med "-term"
235       ns    <- Rop.getTerms            med "-order"
236       from  <- Rop.getOpt 0 Rop.getInt med "-from"
237       dense <- Rop.getSwitch           med "-dense"
238       let relmapRank = if dense
239                        then relmapDenseRank
240                        else relmapGapRank
241       Right $ relmapRank med (n, ns, fromInteger from)
242
243-- | Create @rank -dense@ relmap.
244relmapDenseRank :: (K.CDec c, Ord c) =>
245   C.Intmed c -> (K.TermName, [K.TermName], Int) -> C.Relmap c
246relmapDenseRank med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitDenseRank
247
248-- | Create @rank -dense@ relkit.
249relkitDenseRank :: (Ord c, K.CDec c) => (K.TermName, [K.TermName], Int) -> C.RelkitFlow c
250relkitDenseRank = relkitRanking K.sortByNameDenseRank
251
252-- | Create @rank@ relmap.
253relmapGapRank :: (K.CDec c, Ord c) =>
254   C.Intmed c -> (K.TermName, [K.TermName], Int) -> C.Relmap c
255relmapGapRank med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitGapRank
256
257-- | Create @rank@ relkit.
258relkitGapRank :: (Ord c, K.CDec c) => (K.TermName, [K.TermName], Int) -> C.RelkitFlow c
259relkitGapRank = relkitRanking K.sortByNameGapRank
260
261
262-- ----------------------  repeat
263
264-- | __repeat I R__
265consRepeat :: (Ord c, K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
266consRepeat med =
267  do cnt  <- Rop.getInt    med "-count"
268     rmap <- Rop.getRelmap med "-relmap"
269     Right $ relmapRepeat med cnt rmap
270
271-- | Create @repeat@ relmap.
272relmapRepeat :: (Ord c) => C.Intmed c -> Integer -> K.Map (C.Relmap c)
273relmapRepeat med cnt = C.relmapBinary med $ relkitRepeat cnt
274
275-- | Create @repeat@ relkit.
276relkitRepeat :: forall c. (Ord c) => Integer -> C.RelkitBinary c
277relkitRepeat cnt (C.RelkitOutput he2 kitb2) (Just he1)
278    | K.headEquiv he1 he2 = Right $ kit3
279    | otherwise = Msg.diffHead [he1, he2]
280    where
281    kit3 = C.relkitConflWhole True he1 f [kitb2]
282    f bmaps bo1 =
283        do let [bmap2] = bmaps
284               bmap2'  = C.bmapAlign he2 he1 bmap2
285           bo2 <- rep bmap2' cnt bo1
286           Right bo2
287
288    rep bmap2' = loop where
289        loop c bo | c > 0     = loop (c - 1) =<< bmap2' bo
290                  | otherwise = Right bo
291
292relkitRepeat _ _ _ = C.relkitUnfixed
293
294
295-- ----------------------  array
296
297-- | [array /\/P \/P/ ... -to /\/N E/ ...]
298--     Convert discrete tuples of /\/P \/P/ ...
299--     to term array /\/N/ ....
300--     The first /\/P/ of /\/P \/P/ is a key term
301--     of which content is equal to /E/,
302--     and the second is a value of the key.
303--     When /E/ is omitted, term name content is used,
304--     e.g., @-to \/1 \/2@ means @-to \/1 '\/1 \/2 '\/2@.
305--     The length of /\/P \/P/ ... must be even.
306--     Relmap like @array \/k \/v \/ka \/va -to \/1 \/1a \/2 \/2a ...@
307--     works for multiple key-value pairs.
308--
309--   > RELMAP
310--   >   array /key /val  -to /1 1  /2 2  /3 3  /4 4
311--   >                           :     :     :     :
312--   >                           :.....:.....:.....:.... /key
313--   >
314--   > INPUT                    OUTPUT
315--   >   /group  /key  /val       /group  /1    /2    /3    /4
316--   >   ======= ===== -----      ======= ----- ----- ----- -----
317--   >   'a      1     10         'a      10    20    30    ()
318--   >   'a      2     20         'b      40    50    ()    ()
319--   >   'a      3     30                 .                  .
320--   >   'b      1     40                 :..................:
321--   >   'b      2     50                 term array
322--
323consArray :: (K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
324consArray med =
325  do ps   <- Rop.getTermPairs med "-term"
326     ts   <- Rop.getNamedContentTerms med "-to"
327     let l = length ps
328     Right $ relmapArray med (ps, l, divide l ts)
329
330-- | Create @array@ relmap.
331relmapArray :: (K.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> ([K.TermName2], Int, [[K.Term c]]) -> C.Relmap c
332relmapArray med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitArray
333
334-- | Create @array@ relkit.
335relkitArray :: forall c. (K.CContent c) => ([K.TermName2], Int, [[K.Term c]]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
336relkitArray _ Nothing = C.relkitUnfixed
337relkitArray (unzip -> (names, vals), l, to) (Just he1) = check kit where
338    pre      = K.termPicker (names ++ vals) he1
339    name     = K.termPicker names he1
340    val      = K.termPicker vals he1
341    split cs = (K.cutTerms pre cs, (K.pickTerms name cs, K.pickTerms val cs))
342
343    news     = fst <$> concat to
344    keys     = snd K.<$$> to
345    pk       = K.termPicker news he1
346    he2      = K.headAppend news $ K.headMap (K.cutTerms pre) he1
347    check    = Rop.preCheck name . Rop.preCheck val . Rop.newCheck pk
348    kit      = Right $ C.relkitWhole False he2 flow
349    flow bo  = array <$> K.gatherToAssoc (split <$> bo)
350
351    array :: K.Pair [c] [K.Twin [c]] -> [c]
352    array (group, body) = (values body K.<++> keys) ++ group
353
354    values :: [K.Twin [c]] -> [c] -> [c]
355    values body key = case select key `K.mapMaybe` body of
356                        [vs] -> vs           -- single key
357                        _    -> K.empties l  -- no keys or multiple keys
358
359    select :: [c] -> K.Pair [c] [c] -> Maybe [c]
360    select key (ks, vs) | key == ks  = Just vs
361                        | otherwise  = Nothing
362
363-- >>> divide 2 "abcdef"
364-- ["ab","cd","ef"]
365divide :: Int -> [a] -> [[a]]
366divide n = loop where
367    loop [] = []
368    loop xs = take n xs : loop (drop n xs)
369
370
371-- ----------------------  unarray
372
373-- | [unarray /\/N \/N/ ... -from /\/P E/ ...]
374--     Convert term array /\/P/ ... 
375--     to discrete tuples of /\/N \/N/ ....
376--
377--   > RELMAP
378--   >   unarray /key /val  -from /1 1  /2 2  /3 3  /4 4
379--   >                               :     :     :     :
380--   >                               :.....:.....:.....:.... /key
381--   >
382--   > INPUT                                 OUTPUT
383--   >   /group  /1    /2    /3    /4          /group  /key  /val
384--   >   ======= ----- ----- ----- -----       ======= ===== -----
385--   >   'a      10    20    30    ()          'a      1     10
386--   >   'b      40    50    ()    ()          'a      2     20
387--   >           .                  .          'a      3     30
388--   >           :..................:          'a      4     ()
389--   >           term array                    'b      1     40
390--   >                                         'b      2     50
391--   >                                         'b      3     ()
392--   >                                         'b      4     ()
393--
394consUnarray :: (K.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
395consUnarray med =
396  do ps   <- Rop.getTermPairs med "-term"
397     ts   <- Rop.getNamedContentTerms med "-from"
398     let l = length ps
399     Right $ relmapUnarray med (ps, l, divide l ts)
400
401-- | Create @unarray@ relmap.
402relmapUnarray :: (K.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> ([K.TermName2], Int, [[K.Term c]]) -> C.Relmap c
403relmapUnarray med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitUnarray
404
405-- | Create @unarray@ relkit.
406relkitUnarray :: forall c. (K.CContent c) => ([K.TermName2], Int, [[K.Term c]]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
407relkitUnarray _ Nothing = C.relkitUnfixed
408relkitUnarray (unzip -> (names, vals), _, from) (Just he1) = check kit where
409    news     = names ++ vals
410    new      = K.termPicker news he1
411
412    ns       = fst K.<$$> from
413    keys     = snd K.<$$> from
414    pre      = K.termPicker (concat ns) he1
415    pks      = (`K.termPicker` he1) <$> ns
416    he2      = K.headAppend news $ K.headMap (K.cutTerms pre) he1
417    check    = Rop.newCheck new . Rop.preCheck pre
418    kit      = Right $ C.relkitMany False he2 flow
419
420    flow :: [c] -> [[c]]
421    flow cs = zipWith (f cs) keys pks
422    f cs ks pk = ks ++ K.pickTerms pk cs ++ K.cutTerms pre cs
423
